data.title: Target type support for CreateEffectWarhead
Repair pads don't work in D2k
Improve D2k spiceblooms
data.body:
This adresses most remaining issues left by #8987.
- slower and more random growth rate
- spice 'debris' no longer fly to the same cell
- much more sane projectile angles
- crushing actors are now damaged properly
- `SpiceExplosion` now has a visible projectile. It had a darker one in the original, but I haven't found the image yet, so I'm using `120mm` for now
- make sure that at least the minimum of pieces is spawned and slightly tweak defaults

data.title: Fix the C17 delivery plane doing a steep dive when trying to land
data.body:
Yes, it sucks that the land range is hardcoded. Yes, I will unhardcode it. No, not in this PR. It will be in my PR that completely rewrites this trait to enable proper Starport logic (or it already is, I don't remember; if it isn't request in on that PR next time I reopen it).

The frigate's MaximumPitch is of no consequence.
`MaximumPitch: 56` was removed from the TD `^Plane` because only C17 lands anyway.

data.title: Add copy/paste to the map editor
data.body:
Adds the last major missing piece from the old editor.

I've added the [For stable] label despite the feature freeze because some of our well known map authors have complained that the current editor is useless to them, and that they have kept an old release installed specifically to use the old editor for copy/paste.  Its not really fair to make them wait another full release cycle to have a usable modern editor.  This feature is self-contained, so chances of outside regressions should be low.

data.title: Generate Init, Warhead, Projectile, [& Widget] Documentation
data.body:
Warheads and projectiles already have `Desc` attributes, the trait documentation generator should be reusable, and generated documentation should make it easier for modders to understand these without reading the source code (which not everyone can do).

These would require other pages in the wiki for publishing.

data.title: Hijacker has trouble stealing moving vehicles
data.body:
so apparently , after buffing the speed of the hijacker so he is equally fast as a harvester or medium tank ... it turns out that this doesnt help to fix the problem to actually steal the vehicle ... 

when he is trying to steal a unit that is currently "moving" (harvester) ... he kinda get "set back" after trying to enter the vehicle ... so its looks like he is doing a jump backwards ... 

this is easy to reproduce , just try to steal a moving harvester (it might work sometimes , but it probably also depends on the angle youre coming from) 

people are still not satisfied , but this is something we cant fix by tweaking yaml-rules

data.title: Idea for silo usefulness.
data.body:
When you build a silo it gets a 10% bonus of ore put into it every time a ore truck dumps a load at your refinery. If you build more silo's your bonus is not increased, but spread out amongst those silo's.

So you can choose to build a single silo, but your enemies will know to take it out and you lose all of your bonus. However, If you build more silos you have a greater chance of getting your bonus but it till take longer.
IE: 2 silo's = each get 5% and such I'm not good at math.

This can create some target-of-opportunity situations where you're in the middle of an attack and see your enemies silo is almost full, so you should take the time to destroy it so they get no bonus.

Can you guys even understand what I'm saying?

data.title: D2k, fixed infantry moving too slow on dunes
data.body:
This isn't a 'scientific' fix because I don't believe we know the exact terrain movement stats, but playing the original, infantry definitely seem to move faster on dunes than vehicles and don't have as a slow a speed reduction as there is here.

Adding to that, it does IMO make sense that infantry wouldn't slow down as much and it gives them another nice boost to usability on the battlefield.

data.title: Drop targets out of range if we can't move
data.body:
I noticed that my mammy in guard stance was trying to shoot a far away harvester while letting himself kill by infantry.

Closes #9837.
Closes #6185.
Closes #9849.

data.title: Handle mouse up event in default editor brush (instead of mouse down)

Let the mouse down event bubble up, fixes #9836
EDIT:
- applied this behaviour to all brushes (only affects right clicks), so you can also joystick scroll with with all other brushes

data.title: Implement multiple resource queues
data.body:
Currently, there are only two types of resources: "cash" and "resources". This should not be hardcoded and works badly with TS (which has veins), RA2 (which doesn't have resources), and AoE (which has several different primary types of resources), to name a few.

The obvious part of this work is to implement separate traits for each different type of resource, replacing `PlayerResources`, which may have different properties (to begin with, some resources must have capacities; some must not).

The other part of this is to implement RA/TD/D2K's behaviour of using resources to spend for cash. This should be implemented using a separate trait to indicate the two. There are two different proposed designs (note that the naming is tentative in both designs):

The first is to have an `ResourceAlias` trait which would implement the same abstract interface as a regular resource, but be implemented differently:

```
ResourceAlias: ore-or-cash
    Aliases: ore, cash
```

This would simply be a resource which would link back into the others. Spending this resource would go in order of the `Aliases` array, so in this case, ore first, then cash.

The second is to have a `SubstituteResource` trait which would allow spending one resource in place of another:

```
SubstituteResource:
    Use: ore
    As: cash
    Priority: 1
```

Resources would be used in decreasing order of priority, so a positive priority indicates that ore would be used first; a negative priority would be used to spend ore only after cash was exhausted.

Feedback on which design to use is appreciated.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27910528-implement-multiple-resource-queues?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix hex colors upgrade rules engine version
data.body: The playtest came out (20151031) before hex colors were merged but the upgrade rules use version 20151027.

data.title: Fix viceroids being spawned by crushed infantry
data.body:
Fixes #9831.

The bug was triggered when infantry was killed without a warhead, [as crushing does](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Crushable.cs#L64).

data.title: Connecting to Global IRC chat causes closing OpenRA to hang
data.body:
So I discovered that if at any point I connect to the global IRC chat, quitting OpenRA will hang and It'll either take 10s+ to close or I'll need to ctrl+alt+del and force close the game. If I just watch a replay though I don't have this issue and the game closes normally.

This is on the Halloween playtest, while using Windows 7.

data.title: CnC64 Special Ops GDI01 crashes after training an engineer from a captured Hand of Nod
data.body:
The title says it all. After capturing the Hand of Nod to the east of the player's base, I tried to train an engineer there. The engineer popped out properly, and the game crashed immediately after.
The corresponding log entry says
"Fatal Lua Error: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'e6' does not define a property 'AttackMove'
   в OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptContext.FatalError(String message)
   в OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.ScriptTriggers.TickIdle(Actor self)
   в OpenRA.World.Tick()
   в OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   в OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   в OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   в OpenRA.Game.Run()
   в OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   в OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)"

I guess one should fall back to simple move if no AttackMove is possible...

data.title: Preclude StoresResources.Stored overflow
data.body:
Closes #9857.
Seems ridiculous but oh well.

data.title: Allow for cash refineries.
data.body:
RA2 does not use resources and rather only has cash---that is, there are no limits on resource possession and engineers cannot steal resources.

The easiest and most flexible way to implement this is to allow cash-only refineries, which would allow RA2 to not use resources at all. It would also open up the possibility for future modders to have refineries which give cash rather than resources.
